item.title: Singapore is in the process of updating its patent laws
item.description:
The Singapore Ministry of Law (MinLaw) submitted the Patents (Amendment) Bill to Parliament for its initial review. The Ministry stated these changes aim to improve the patent system in Singapore by enhancing the quality of patents granted and making the process more user-friendly. Two main changes are proposed. First, all patent applications will undergo a complete examination by the Intellectual Property Office of Singapore (IPOS) to guarantee that all inventions meet Singapore’s patentability requirements...

item.title: Singapore has modified its regulations for the protection of designs
item.description:
Singapore’s Ministry of Law (MinLaw) has introduced the Registered Designs (Amendment) Bill to Parliament for its first reading. The bill aims to modernize Singapore’s design protection laws by reflecting current design and technology developments. It seeks to foster growth in the design sector by streamlining the process for designers to safeguard their creations. item.title: A book comparing Asian data privacy laws to international standards is available
item.description:
Graham Greenleaf’s Asian Data Privacy Laws: Trade & Human Rights Perspectives (ISBN 978-0-19-967966-9) is a groundbreaking examination of data privacy legislation across Asia. Source: OUP. Professor Greenleaf, a Law Professor at the University of New South Wales, Australia, and Co-founder and Co-Director of the open-access Australasian Legal Information Institute, explores 26 countries and individual jurisdictions. The book provides a thorough analysis of the 14 jurisdictions with specific data privacy laws, comparing them to global benchmarks...
